abstract_summ: The COVID-19 adjusted prevalence rates in rural counties were substantially elevated in counties with higher black populations, smoking rates, and obesity rates.Counties with high rates of people aged 25-49 years had increased COVID-19 prevalence rates.Indeed, population densities and case incidence rates are negatively correlated, with a -33% correlation coefficient.To aid in the legislative decision process and proper channelizing of resources, we estimated and compared the county-level change in prevalence rates of COVID-19 by rural-urban status over 3 weeks.PURPOSE There are growing signs that the COVID-19 virus has started to spread to rural areas and can impact the rural health care system that is already stretched and lacks resources.
title_summ: Progression of COVID-19 From Urban to Rural Areas in the United States: A Spatiotemporal Analysis of Prevalence Rates.Variation in Covid-19 Cases Across New York CityCounty-level factors influence the trajectory of Covid-19 incidenceSpatial analysis and GIS in the study of COVID-19.A review.
title_abstract_phrases: The COVID-19 adjusted prevalence rates in rural counties were substantially elevated in counties with higher black populations, smoking rates, and obesity rates.Counties with high rates of people aged 25-49 years had increased COVID-19 prevalence rates.Indeed, population densities and case incidence rates are negatively correlated, with a -33% correlation coefficient.Variation in Covid-19 Cases Across New York CityThe number of confirmed COVID -19 cases, relative to the population size, has varied greatly throughout the United States and, even, within the same city.Progression of COVID-19 From Urban to Rural Areas in the United States: A Spatiotemporal Analysis of Prevalence Rates.
